TEI.2.document_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 1, pp. 304

barker_notes.barker_footnotes: This ticket is No. 1 in a booklet containing seventy-two tickets numbered consecutively. They were printed six to the page and were clipped off as sold. This sheaf was evidently taken by Moses Austin for sale, and notes on the stabs of missing tickets in his hand writing show the disposition made of them : Number 6, "Sold to William Gale March 21"; Number 14, "James E. B. Austin. Sold"; Number 20, "Delivered Colo Pettitt and recd 144 "; Number 21, "E. Weber Sold"; Number 22, "Emily B Bryan Sold"; Number 83, 44 "Sold to Wm Inge"; Numbers 49-50, "Mary Austin Sold."
barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 1, pp. 304

div1.p: This ticket will entitle the bearer hereof, to such prize as may be drawn to its number, subject to a deduction of 15 per cent.
L Brown Prest, of the Board of Commis'ers.
